Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav swatted Blair Tickner over mid-off to help India level the series 1-1 with one match to go.
All of them troubled New Zealand and restricted them to a mere 99 for 8. It was New Zealand's lowest total against India in a full-length T20I.
There would be no six in India's innings either.
Pre-Game Insights: Keeping that in mind, Mitchell Santner opted to bat after winning the toss.
With the red-soil pitch at the Ekana Stadium expected to help spinners, India brought in Yuzvendra Chahal for Umran Malik.
That gave them four spin-bowling options, including Deepak Hooda.
Post-Match Reflections: In the end, it came down to 13 required from 12 balls. Lockie Ferguson conceded only seven off the 19th over despite Hardik finding a boundary.
Miscellaneous Highlights: It was New Zealand's lowest total against India in a full-length T20I.
In all, spinners bowled 30 overs in the match - the second-most in any T20I, and the most in a game involving Full Member teams.
